title: The Three Levels of SA
content: Level 1 is perception—detecting cues in your environment. Level 2 is comprehension—understanding what those cues mean. Level 3 is projection—predicting what will happen next. Most operational errors occur at Levels 2 and 3: people perceive correctly but misinterpret or fail to anticipate. Each level builds on the previous; you cannot project accurately without first perceiving and comprehending.

mcq.question: You notice a temperature reading of 185°F (Level 1). You know the normal range is 150-170°F and this indicates overheating (Level 2). What would complete Level 3?

options.A: Recording the reading in the log
options.B: Predicting the system will trip on high temperature in approximately 10 minutes at current rate
options.C: Reporting the reading to your supervisor
options.D: Checking other temperature readings for comparison

mcq.explanation: Level 3 is projection—predicting future state based on current trends. The other options are actions, but projection specifically means anticipating what will happen if current conditions continue.

openQuestions: Which of the three SA levels do you find most challenging to maintain under pressure?
Think of a recent operational situation. Can you identify what you perceived, what you understood, and what you predicted?
